subject: Re: Testing async calls
msgSnippet: ... wrote: The things I have been recommending so far are ... various ... Is this book out in the market? On a general note: Do you think it s worth writing
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
The things I have been recommending so far are
> techniques he writes about. My book, "JUnit Recipes" includes
various
> recipes for testing legacy J2EE components.

Is this book out in the market?

On a general note: Do you think it's worth writing JUnit test cases
for all the classes present in legacy code. The number of class
would be somewhere around 1000. If not, what areas do we need to
concentrate to write test cases for?

Thanks,
Kalyan.

>
> What I recommended in my previous response is the kind of thing
that
> you'll find in either book.
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
> Diaspar Software Services
> http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> Let's write software that people understand
